CommentsTitle: Solid build quality, minor flaw is that my wireless mouse must be within 1 foot of receiver
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States April 23, 2020
CommentsContent: I have tried a few of these USB-C dongles and they all seem to have some pro and cons. I will list my findings on other products at the bottom for comparison.This dongle seems to be built well and with quality materials (aluminum?). Unlike other products, the HDMI port (to connect a second monitor) does not intermittently go out and doesn't need to be wiggled into just the right position. Any position seems to work and it can be moved around without worrying about losing connection. The USB-C port for pass through power delivery seems to work fine for powering my laptop and phone. The usb 3.0 ports work well with my external HD, thumb drive, and a wired mouse. HOWEVER, all three of my wireless mice (via usb 3) need to be within a foot of the usb receiver to work effectively. When the dongle is plugged in on the opposite side of my mouse, it is very jerky/laggy or just simply won't work. It must supply a lower amount of power than other products. I will not use the ethernet port so I can't comment on how that works.Overall, at <$30 it's the best bang for the buck dongle I've used so far.Other dongles I've tried...Insignia 3 in 1 (from Best Buy):Pros - If I didn't touch or move the HDMI or dongle, everything worked great and I could use my wireless mouse 3' away from receiverCons - More expensive at $40, HDMI connection wasn't stable, got hot while using, cheap plastic, only 1 usb 3.0 slotApple 3 in 1 (my wife's):Pros - All ports worked pretty wellCons - Way overpriced at $70, HDMI connection went out once or twice but mostly stable, cheap plastic, only 1 usb 3.0 slotI wouldn't be surprised if apple and insignia were made in the same factory, they are almost identical, but the Apple one seemed to work a little better.Overall I recommend this over Insignia or Apple. Unless I find a solution to getting wireless mice to work better, I will make this work.

While this isn't the most uncommon thing for anything running power through it, I'd expect an easier design like this to not have coil whine. I will give props to the Ethernet and USB 3 ports though. No issues on this. Overall 1/5 stars considering this product is $40 and only 2 out of the 4 functions work properly. Very disappointed and will be returning.
